Dear Collegiate Families—

Beginning on Tuesday, September 1, through Monday, September 14, we ask that families please come to Collegiate to pick up their child/ren’s textbooks and Chromebooks to be prepared for the 2020-21 school year. We will be distributing between the hours of 8:30AM - 5PM.

Please note:
*All students, whether online or in-person, are required to pickup their textbooks.
**We will not be distributing books on Labor Day, September 7th.
***Important: We have prioritized the students who are starting online with Chromebooks. As soon as we get the rest of the Chromebooks in, we will be distributing to the rest.
Thank you ahead of time for your patience.

YOU Matter—
Dr. Hodgdon

Miss Z has a message:

I miss my students. I miss their faces. I miss their smiles. I miss their laughs. I miss our conversations. I miss walking down the halls and getting high fives and fist bumps. I miss being in the gym for class each day. I miss our inside jokes. I miss teaching. I miss my students teaching me about SO many things each day. I miss school.⁣
⁣
The one thing I do know right now is that my students are resilient and strong. We all will get through this together. I’m still loving each of you and always will! Right now I’m going to have to settle for lots of virtual hugs. But, when we are back I’ll be giving ALL the hugs possible. 💓#imissmystudents #imissteaching

Dear Parents/Guardians:

It has been brought to our attention that there is a very dangerous and undesirable “challenge” circulating among young people around the world at the moment called the Skull Breaker Challenge.

Essentially, this “game” involves three people who begin to jump up and down and then two of them kick the legs away from the other, thus causing the middle person to fall on his/her back, neck, or head. I am sure you can understand how extremely dangerous and reckless this is. To make matters worse, the children use their telephones to take a video of it and then post it on social media.

There have been a growing number of serious injuries caused by this activity and two deaths.

I encourage all parents to engage their children in a discussion about this dangerous activity. We will be doing the same in classes at school. If any students are found to be participating in this “challenge” during school hours, their choice will result in serious consequences.

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best Regards,
Dr. Hodgdon

Happy Holidays to our Collegiate Families--

In the spirit of this holiday season, I want to extend my thanks to all of you for everything that you do for our school. As we enjoy the upcoming holidays, it is my fervent wish that each of you receives and returns the seasonal bounty of blessings and good tidings that make these days truly special. In this spirit, please enjoy the beautiful 2020 calendar that will be coming home with your student(s) tomorrow.

It is also during this time that I am reminded of my own good fortune to serve as the proud Director of Collegiate Charter School of Lowell. Indeed, my career as a public school educator has afforded me vast, varied and richly rewarding opportunities to teach and to learn from young people.

Of course, I believe the faces of our children best express the true meaning of this holiday season. They radiate a sense of unbridled enthusiasm, untainted hope and unabashed joy for life and the opportunities that await them.

Please have a safe and joyous holiday season.

Better Together—
Dr. Hodgdon

Greetings Collegiate Parents/Guardians--

This week finds our students excited for the holiday vacation, but with exams to take first. We appreciate you making sure that our students get a good night's rest and are prepared to take their exams each day.

A few important reminders:
-After school homework help and tutoring will not be held this week. Both will resume Monday, January 6th. All students should be picked up after school unless students participate in the After School Program.
-On Friday, December 20th, students are welcome to dress down in an ugly sweater/favorite team sweatshirt.

As always, we appreciate working in partnership with all of you around our amazing students, and look forward to their academic success this week.

YOU Matter--
Dr. Hodgdon

Dear Collegiate Parents and Guardians--

I hope that you all enjoyed your Thanksgiving holiday with family and friends. I know that I did, but I am rested and ready for the next three weeks that will bring us to the December break.

The next three weeks will be busy with activity: a final week of Term 1 learning, a week of revision and a week of exams. Please note: We will be sending an exam schedule in the next few days. If you have questions/concerns, please do not hesitate to contact.

A few reminders:
-Please send your student(s) to school dressed warmly and prepared to be outside (hat, gloves and boots). It is always our goal to get our students outside for fresh air and activity.
-As you all know, we close school if Lowell Public closes. Be sure to check our social media sites for the official announcement. We will also email and call all of you.

Stay warm!

YOU Matter, and we are better together at Collegiate--

Dr. Hodgdon
